stimulusHtml: Which of the following best explains the political instability that emerged during the 1990s in parts of eastern Europe after the collapse of communism?

features.html: The following question refers to the topic of the emergence of two superpowers.

choicesHtml: The expansion of the European Union disrupted established political boundaries.
The reemergence of nationalism revived older cultural and political tensions.
The dissolution of the Warsaw Pact removed security guarantees for many eastern European countries.
The transition to capitalism in eastern Europe politically empowered a newly emerging middle class.
